verses.verse: Ephraim<WH669> feeds<WH7462> on wind<WH7307>, and follows<WH7291> after the east wind<WH6921>: he daily<WH3117> increases<WH7235> lies<WH3577> and desolation<WH7701>; and they do make<WH3772> a covenant<WH1285> with the Assyrians<WH804>, and oil<WH8081> is carried<WH2986> into Egypt<WH4714>.

The Lord<WH3068> has also a controversy<WH7379> with Judah<WH3063>, and will punish<WH6485> Jacob<WH3290> according to his ways<WH1870>; according to his doings<WH4611> will he recompense him<WH7725>.
He took his brother<WH251> by the heel<WH6117> in the womb<WH990>, and by his strength<WH202> he had power<WH8280> with God<WH430>:

Is there iniquity<WH205> in Gilead<WH1568>? surely they are vanity<WH7723>: they sacrifice<WH2076> bullocks<WH7794> in Gilgal<WH1537>; Yes<WH4196>, their altars are as heaps<WH1530> in the furrows<WH8525> of the fields<WH7704>.

And by a prophet<WH5030> the Lord<WH3068> brought<WH5927> Israel<WH3478> out of Egypt<WH4714>, and by a prophet<WH5030> was he preserved<WH8104>.

Ephraim<WH669> provoked him to anger<WH3707> most bitterly<WH8563>: therefore shall he leave<WH5203> his blood<WH1818> upon him<WH2781>, and his reproach shall his Lord<WH113> return unto him<WH7725>.
